definitions: person who extracts minerals or coal from underground or surface deposits
software or algorithm that searches through data to discover patterns and extract information
examples: The coal miners descended into the shaft before sunrise
Several miners were trapped when the tunnel collapsed yesterday
The data miner discovered unusual patterns in customer purchasing behavior
They deployed text miners to analyze millions of social media posts

definitions: naturally occurring solid inorganic substance with specific chemical composition and crystalline structure
essential inorganic substance required by organisms for proper physiological function and health
examples: Quartz is one of the most abundant minerals in Earth's crust
The geologist identified several rare minerals in the rock sample
She takes daily mineral supplements containing iron and calcium
Many breakfast cereals are fortified with essential vitamins and minerals

definitions: military ship designed to detect and remove underwater mines from waterways
single-player puzzle video game where players clear grid squares without detonating hidden mines
examples: The minesweeper carefully cleared the harbor before merchant ships arrived
Several minesweepers were deployed to secure the shipping lanes
She played minesweeper during her lunch break at work
The classic Windows minesweeper game has entertained millions worldwide

definitions: act of moving around and interacting socially with different people at gatherings
examples: The mingling of guests continued throughout the cocktail reception
There was pleasant mingling between the two families at dinner

definitions: something that is smaller than normal size or a miniature version
very short skirt with hemline well above the knees
examples: She bought a mini version of her favorite perfume for travel
The store sells mini cupcakes perfect for children's parties
She wore a leather mini to the nightclub on Saturday
The fashion designer's collection featured several colorful minis

definitions: highly detailed small-scale reproduction or model of something larger
very small detailed painting, especially a portrait on ivory or vellum
examples: The museum displayed miniature replicas of famous buildings
He collects miniature trains and has built an elaborate railway
The Victorian miniature portrait was painted on an ivory medallion
Several Renaissance miniatures decorated the margins of the manuscript

definitions: process of making things smaller while maintaining or improving their functionality and efficiency
examples: The miniaturization of electronics has revolutionized portable device design
Advances in miniaturization allowed smartphones to become increasingly powerful

definitions: art movement emphasizing simplicity through use of basic forms and limited elements
lifestyle philosophy focused on living with fewer possessions and prioritizing essential experiences
examples: The gallery featured minimalism works with stark geometric shapes
Japanese architecture greatly influenced the development of Western minimalism
She embraced minimalism and donated most of her belongings
The minimalism movement encourages people to focus on meaningful experiences

definitions: artist or designer who practices minimalism through simplified forms and reduced elements
person who intentionally lives with fewer possessions and embraces simplicity
examples: The minimalist sculptor used only steel cubes in her installation
Several minimalist painters exhibited their monochromatic works downtown
As a minimalist, she owns only thirty items of clothing
The minimalist blogger shares tips for decluttering living spaces

definitions: act or process of reducing something to the smallest possible amount or degree
examples: Cost minimization remains the company's primary operational strategy this year
The minimization of environmental impact guided the project design

definitions: smallest or lowest amount, degree, or quantity that is possible or required
point where a function reaches its lowest value in a given interval
examples: The minimum wage increased to fifteen dollars per hour
You need a minimum score of seventy to pass the exam
The algorithm finds the global minimum of the cost function
The graph shows a local minimum at x equals three

definitions: process and industry of extracting minerals or other geological materials from earth
computational process of discovering patterns in large data sets using various methods
examples: Coal mining has declined significantly in the past decade
The mining operation required extensive environmental impact assessments
Data mining techniques revealed unexpected customer behavior patterns
Text mining software analyzed thousands of research papers automatically

definitions: servile follower or subordinate who unquestioningly carries out orders
small yellow cylindrical animated creatures from the Despicable Me film franchise
examples: The villain sent his minions to carry out the evil plan
The corrupt politician's minions spread false information online
Children love the funny minions from the animated movies
She bought minion toys for her nephew's birthday party

definitions: ordained religious leader authorized to conduct services and perform religious duties
senior government official heading a ministry or serving in cabinet
examples: The minister delivered an inspiring sermon about forgiveness yesterday
Our new minister organized several community outreach programs
The finance minister announced major changes to tax policy
Several ministers attended the emergency cabinet meeting this morning

definitions: work and duties performed by religious ministers or the period of this service
government department headed by a minister responsible for specific area of public administration
examples: She devoted thirty years to ministry in rural communities
His ministry focused on helping homeless families find shelter
The Ministry of Education announced new curriculum standards today
She works for the Ministry of Health developing vaccination programs

definitions: passenger vehicle designed for family transport with sliding doors and multiple seating rows
examples: They bought a minivan when their third child was born
The soccer team traveled to games in the coach's minivan

definitions: small semiaquatic carnivorous mammal valued for its lustrous dark brown fur
coat or garment made from the fur of mink animals
examples: Wild mink hunt for fish along the riverbank at dawn
The farm raised mink for the international fur trade
She inherited her grandmother's vintage mink coat from the 1950s
The actress wore a white mink stole to the premiere

definitions: small freshwater fish often used as bait for catching larger fish
person or organization considered small or insignificant compared to others
examples: He caught several minnows to use as bait for bass
Schools of minnows swam through the shallow creek water
The startup was a minnow compared to tech giants
Our local team played like minnows against the champions

definitions: person under the age of legal adulthood, typically under eighteen years
secondary field of academic study pursued alongside a major subject
examples: The law prohibits selling alcohol to minors under twenty-one
The court appointed a guardian for the minor child
She chose psychology as her minor while majoring in biology
His minor in Spanish proved valuable for international business

definitions: smaller number or part representing less than half of the whole population
state of being under the age of legal majority or full legal responsibility
examples: Women remain a minority in corporate boardrooms nationwide
The minority party strongly opposed the proposed legislation
The trust fund remains locked during his minority until age twenty-one
Property decisions require court approval during a child's minority

definitions: medieval entertainer who traveled performing songs and reciting poetry for nobility
examples: The minstrel entertained the castle court with ballads and stories
Wandering minstrels spread news between villages in medieval times

definitions: aromatic plant with leaves used for flavoring food and drinks
candy or flavoring with cool refreshing taste from mint plants
facility where money is manufactured under government authority
perfect undamaged condition, especially for collectible items
examples: She grows fresh mint in her herb garden for tea
The recipe calls for chopped mint leaves and lemon
He offered her a mint after their garlic-heavy dinner
The toothpaste has a strong mint flavor that feels refreshing
The Royal Mint produces millions of coins each year
Tours of the mint show how paper money is printed
The vintage comic book remains in mint condition
Collectors pay premium prices for mint condition baseball cards

definitions: slow, stately ballroom dance in triple time originating in 17th century France
examples: The couple performed an elegant minuet at the period ball
Mozart composed several minuets for chamber orchestra performances

definitions: unit of time equal to sixty seconds or one sixtieth of an hour
official written record of proceedings and decisions made during a meeting
examples: The train arrives exactly fifteen minutes past every hour
She can run a mile in under six minutes
The secretary read the minutes from last month's board meeting
Please review these minutes before approving them for distribution

definitions: extraordinary event attributed to divine intervention defying natural laws
highly improbable or extraordinary event, development, or accomplishment
examples: Many pilgrims visit the shrine believing in healing miracles
The religious text describes several miracles performed by prophets
It's a miracle that everyone survived the plane crash
The doctor called her recovery nothing short of a miracle

definitions: optical phenomenon where light refraction creates illusory images, especially in deserts
something illusory, without substance, or impossible to achieve
examples: The desert travelers saw a mirage of water shimmering ahead
Heat mirages on the highway made the road appear wet
His promises of wealth turned out to be just a mirage
The perfect relationship she imagined was merely a mirage

definitions: area of swampy or boggy ground with mud that makes movement difficult
situation or state of difficulty, distress, or embarrassment from which escape is hard
examples: The horses struggled through the mire after heavy rains
Their boots sank deep into the muddy mire
The company found itself in a legal mire of lawsuits
He was stuck in a mire of debt and couldn't escape

definitions: smooth surface, typically glass coated with metal, that reflects clear images
something that gives an accurate representation or reflection of something else
examples: She checked her appearance in the bathroom mirror before leaving
The antique mirror had an ornate golden frame
His behavior mirrors that of his father perfectly
The novel mirrors the social issues of its time

definitions: gladness or gaiety accompanied by laughter demonstrating amusement or joy
examples: The comedian's jokes filled the room with mirth and laughter
Her eyes sparkled with mirth at his silly antics

definitions: unfortunate incident or mishap, typically one causing mild harm or inconvenience rather than serious injury
examples: Their camping trip turned into a misadventure when they got lost
She laughed while recounting her misadventures in cooking class

definitions: state of being incorrectly aligned or positioned relative to the proper arrangement
examples: The misalignment of the wheels caused uneven tire wear
Spinal misalignment can lead to chronic back pain problems

definitions: unauthorized or improper use of funds or property belonging to another person or organization
examples: The executive faced charges for misappropriation of company funds
The audit revealed misappropriation of charitable donations by staff

definitions: behavior that is inappropriate, incorrect, or not in accordance with accepted standards
examples: The teacher addressed the student's misbehavior during class time
Repeated misbehavior resulted in suspension from the team

definitions: behavior that is inappropriate, incorrect, or not in accordance with accepted standards
examples: The headmaster won't tolerate misbehaviour in the assembly hall
Her misbehaviour at the party embarrassed her parents greatly

definitions: mistake in calculating or computing numerical values or mathematical problems
error in judgment or assessment about a situation, person, or outcome
examples: A small miscalculation in the engineering plans caused structural problems
The accounting miscalculation resulted in incorrect tax filings
His miscalculation of public opinion cost him the election
The general's strategic miscalculation led to military defeat

definitions: spontaneous loss of a pregnancy before the fetus can survive outside the womb
failure of a system or plan, especially relating to justice or legal proceedings
examples: She experienced a miscarriage during her first trimester
The doctor explained that early miscarriages are unfortunately common
The wrongful conviction represented a serious miscarriage of justice
The investigation aimed to prevent any miscarriage of justice

definitions: group or collection of different items, writings, or people of various types
examples: The bookshop sold a miscellany of rare manuscripts and maps
Her desk drawer contained a miscellany of paper clips and rubber bands

definitions: playful misbehavior or troublemaking, especially in children
harm or trouble caused by someone or something
examples: The children got into mischief while their parents were away
His eyes sparkled with mischief as he planned the prank
The new law aims to prevent mischief by vandals
Storm damage and mischief cost the company thousands

definitions: view or opinion that is incorrect because based on faulty thinking or understanding
examples: It's a common misconception that goldfish have three-second memories
The teacher corrected several misconceptions about gravity and weight

definitions: unacceptable or improper behavior, especially by an employee or professional
wrongful, improper, or unlawful conduct motivated by premeditated or intentional purpose
examples: The lawyer was disbarred for professional misconduct
Several officers faced misconduct charges after the investigation
The committee investigated allegations of research misconduct
Student misconduct can result in academic suspension

definitions: criminal offense less serious than a felony, typically punishable by fine or short jail term
examples: Shoplifting items under fifty dollars constitutes a misdemeanor
He pleaded guilty to misdemeanor charges of disorderly conduct

definitions: person who hoards wealth and spends as little money as possible
examples: The old miser counted his coins every night before bed
Despite his wealth, the miser refused to heat his house

definitions: state of great physical or mental distress, suffering, or extreme unhappiness
examples: The refugees endured terrible misery in the overcrowded camps
She couldn't hide her misery after losing her job

definitions: failure of a gun or engine to fire or operate correctly
failure of a plan or action to produce the intended result
examples: The engine misfire caused the car to shake violently
A misfire in the old rifle could be dangerous
The marketing campaign was a complete misfire with consumers
His attempt at humor was a misfire that offended everyone

definitions: person whose behavior or attitude sets them apart from others in an uncomfortably conspicuous way
examples: He felt like a misfit at the exclusive private school
The movie celebrates misfits who don't conform to society

definitions: adverse event or circumstance resulting from bad luck or unfortunate circumstances
examples: She had the misfortune of losing her passport while traveling
A series of misfortunes left the family nearly bankrupt

definitions: unfortunate accident or unlucky event, typically not resulting in serious harm
examples: A kitchen mishap left dinner slightly burned but edible
Despite several mishaps, they managed to complete the project

definitions: false or inaccurate information, especially that which is deliberately intended to deceive
examples: Social media platforms struggle to combat the spread of misinformation
The misinformation about vaccines has serious public health consequences

definitions: process or action of managing something badly, incompetently, or dishonestly
examples: Financial mismanagement led to the company's bankruptcy
The scandal revealed years of mismanagement at the highest levels

definitions: failure to correspond or match between two or more things
pairing of people or things unsuited to each other
examples: There's a mismatch between his skills and job requirements
The color mismatch between the paint samples was obvious
Their marriage was a mismatch from the very beginning
The mismatch in playing ability made the game boring
